Description: A hollow head of a man broken from a terracotta figure, rather grotesque of feature and mainly bald, with a roll of hair extending from above the ears round the rear of the head. Modelled front and back. Neck restored in modern times in hard plaster. Two-piece mould. Brown Nile silt, no apparent mica.
Curator's comments: Terracotta IV Purchased. Ptolemaic, third or second century BC. Bibliog: Stevens' 'Sale Catalogue', 14 December 1866: Gupper Bey's Sale: lot 37.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3581)
